    • Method Detail

      • FinishTask

        public boolean FinishTask(java.lang.String taskName)
        Removes the given name!'s task, puts in the finished task list and reorder the elements after the element in the same category.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the task what is finished.
        Returns:
        true if the remove was successful and the active list had contained the task. Return false otherwise.

      • addTask

        public void addTask(java.lang.String taskName,
                    java.time.LocalDate deadLine,
                    java.lang.String priorCat,
                    java.lang.Integer priority)
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the task. It must be UNIQUE!
        deadLine - The time when the task had to be finished.
        priorCat - The category of priority. It can be A, B or C;
        priority - The importance of the task.

      • getTaskIndex

        public java.lang.Integer getTaskIndex(java.lang.String taskName)
        Adds the index of the task in the active task list.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name what's index we search for.
        Returns:
        the index of the task if it is in the active task list and -1 otherwise.

      • changePriorCat

        public void changePriorCat(java.lang.String taskName,
                           java.lang.String newPriorCat)
        Changes a task's priority category. If the new category is higher than the older, the task will have the worst (highest value) priority in the new category. If the new category is lower than the old one, the task will be the first in that.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the task what's priority category we want to change.
        newPriorCat - The new priority category we want to use. It can be: "A", "B" or "C".

      • getLastPriorityInCategory

        public java.lang.Integer getLastPriorityInCategory(java.lang.String priorCat)
        Gives the last priority value of the given priority category.
        Parameters:
        priorCat - The priority category what we want to find the last priority.
        Returns:
        The last element of the priority category.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished(java.lang.String taskName)
        Checks if the task is finished.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the task what we want to check if it is finished.
        Returns:
        true if the task is finished and false otherwise.

      • clearFinished

        public void clearFinished()

        It gives the names of the active tasks.
        Returns:
        the name of the tasks

      • setTaskName

        public boolean setTaskName(java.lang.String oldName,
                           java.lang.String newName)
        Renames the task if there is no other task with the new name
        Parameters:
        oldName - The task name what we want to change.
        newName - The name what we want to use in the future.
        Returns:
        True if the name change was successful and false if it is failed.
